column4: Does anyone know how to display the output before GDM is started to an external? My monitor on my laptop is broken, and I can't read fsck errors to get it to boot.
I can't see anything I am editing to the Xorg file
All I have is a root prompt, I'm looking for more of a commant I can just enter to switch it.
Like I said, my LAPTOP MONITOR IS BROKEN, I can barely see anything on the screen at all. Yes I see the very top left corner but that is it.
I can see GRUB start, and then I get some fsck errors. Exactly what I don't know.
ok graphics card drivers gone bad?
it kind of makes sense to do  a reinstall when it's next version, because then you can have Ext4 instead of Ext3
,but I can try on someone elses' computer anyway so :D  ,but only try through remote connect
using a Live CD untill  next release  maybe a bit sucky, but   once the stuff is in RAM  things will be ok
or  put Ibex on temporily a clean install. and  then do another clean install of next one or  something
yes it's an option with next Ubuntu
there was a speed comparision test and  that, that I saw
Ext4 really did kick Ext3's arse
